customer_name: East Coast Exotic Animal Rescue Inc
site_name: East Coast Exotic Animal Rescue Inc

citations.narrative:
A large tree has fallen onto the perimeter fence, behind the vervet enclosure, which has caused the fencing to collapse.
The facility has removed some of the branches, but the majority of the tree trunk remains on the fencing.
Areas of the perimeter fence which are in a state of disrepair impact the integrity of the fence and can potentially allow the
entry of other animals.
Perimeter fences must be constructed so that they prevent entry of unauthorized persons or other unwanted species.
Correct by removing the tree from the perimeter fence.

In the fallow deer enclosure, there are two areas in a state of disrepair. The temporary fence in the front of the enclosure,
has partially fallen causing sharp points to be exposed to the animals. Adjacent to this area, there is a pile of metal
fencing on the ground with sharp points exposed and the potential for entanglement.
Enclosures with sharp points or unstable structures can allow for entrapment or injury of the animals.
The facility must remove, repair, or replace the above mentioned items in the fallow deer enclosure to protect the animals
from injury.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.78(d)  Repeat
   
Outdoor housing facilities. 
A large tree has fallen onto the perimeter fence, behind the vervet enclosure, which has caused the fencing to collapse. 
The facility has removed some of the branches, but the majority of the tree trunk remains on the fencing. 
Areas of the perimeter fence which are in a state of disrepair impact the integrity of the fence and can potentially allow the 
entry of other animals. 
Perimeter fences must be constructed so that they prevent entry of unauthorized persons or other unwanted species. 
Correct by removing the tree from the perimeter fence. 
3.125(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
In the fallow deer enclosure, there are two areas in a state of disrepair. The temporary fence in the front of the enclosure, 
has partially fallen causing sharp points to be exposed to the animals. Adjacent to this area, there is a pile of metal 
fencing on the ground with sharp points exposed and the potential for entanglement.  
Enclosures with sharp points or unstable structures can allow for entrapment or injury of the animals. 
The facility must remove, repair, or replace the above mentioned items in the fallow deer enclosure to protect the animals 
from injury. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
